newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil agrees to reschedule Surinam debt.
newsitem.headline: Brazil agrees to reschedule Surinam debt.

text.p: The Brazilian government agreed Tuesday to reschedule about $70 million of debt owed by Surinam, Brazil's finance ministry said in a statement.
The agreement, which has yet to be approved by Brazil's Senate, was reached by Pedro Malan and Motilall Mungra, the finance ministers of Brazil and Surinam, the statement said.

"The agreement with Surinam is part of an effort to recover Brazilian credits owed by countries which for a long time have been having problems making payments in foreign currencies," the statement said without giving further details of the accord.
